svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
March 9, 2024" date: "2024-03-08"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade (meta EIP7569 )
* Reminder: mainnet upgrades to Dencun March 13, epoch 269568, update your nodes
Metrika: node readiness tracker, 58% already updated
* Metrika: node readiness tracker, 58% already updated
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
* Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Electra upgrade scope (small cross layer fork targeting late 2024): EIP7549 move
committee index outside attestation : onchain aggregate optimization discussion
Issuance adjustment : mixed community feedback, ongoing discussions, small code change,
aim for go/no go mid year on including in Electra EIP7547 inclusion lists (candidate
for Electra): breakout call next week, spec ~75% ready EIP7251 max effective balance
(candidate for Electra): greater support for including in Electra, previous pushback
was complexity which Prysm will review again Discussions: keymanager API auth
standardization, Beacon API block value standardization, specifying late block behavior
and ePBS payload boost
* Electra upgrade scope (small cross layer fork targeting late 2024): EIP7549 move
was complexity which Prysm will review again
Electra upgrade scope (small cross layer fork targeting late 2024):
* EIP7549 move committee index outside attestation : onchain aggregate optimization
discussion
EIP7549 move committee index outside attestation : onchain aggregate optimization
* Issuance adjustment : mixed community feedback, ongoing discussions, small code
change, aim for go/no go mid year on including in Electra
aim for go/no go mid year on including in Electra
* EIP7547 inclusion lists (candidate for Electra): breakout call next week, spec ~75%
ready
EIP7547 inclusion lists (candidate for Electra): breakout call next week, spec ~75%
* EIP7251 max effective balance (candidate for Electra): greater support for including
in Electra, previous pushback was complexity which Prysm will review again
EIP7251 max effective balance (candidate for Electra): greater support for including in
Electra, previous pushback was complexity which Prysm will review again
* Discussions: keymanager API auth standardization, Beacon API block value
standardization, specifying late block behavior and ePBS payload boost
Discussions: keymanager API auth standardization, Beacon API block value
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Teku v24.3.0 : improved block rewards calculation performance
Consensus layer:
* Teku v24.3.0 : improved block rewards calculation performance
* Execution layer: Besu v24.3.0 : Bonsai storage format & Snap sync now default and
Bonsai updated to reduce disk usage
Execution layer:
* Besu v24.3.0 : Bonsai storage format & Snap sync now default and Bonsai updated to
reduce disk usage
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 31.06% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 31.06% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority,
could cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm 37%, any client bug over 33.3% could
mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm 37%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
* State growth viz : ERC20 is 27.2% of state, ERC721 is 21.6%; consumer hardware
predicted to sustain current growth rates for a decade
State growth viz : ERC20 is 27.2% of state, ERC721 is 21.6%; consumer hardware
* Geth dropping support for pre-merge networks & almost halved CPU usage
Geth dropping support for pre-merge networks & almost halved CPU usage
* Light clients breakout call notes
Light clients breakout call notes
Inclusion Lists ( EIP7547 )
* Proof of Concept specification
Proof of Concept specification
* Terence: Inclusion lists variation , current slot inclusion list summary is committed
within a block Address censorship in relayers & builders by allowing validators to
include own transactions
Terence:
* Inclusion lists variation , current slot inclusion list summary is committed within a
block
Inclusion lists variation , current slot inclusion list summary is committed within a
* Address censorship in relayers & builders by allowing validators to include own
transactions
Address censorship in relayers & builders by allowing validators to include own
* Discussion on whether inclusion lists are the right solution
Discussion on whether inclusion lists are the right solution
For Stakers
* Lighthouse user survey results
Research
* Execution tickets economic analysis: tickets must be sold at their intrinsic value
otherwise value would leak into a secondary market
Support the Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense fund
The Biden administration is attempting to criminalize open source software development
as part of its war on crypto.
The fundraiser ends March 15. Donate to defend our innocent Ethereum heroes .
Layer 2
* EIP4844 blobs: Optimism Superchain savings estimator and methodology zk rollup saving
estimates Rollup spending on posting data in February, prior to changing to blobs
EIP4844 blobs:
* Optimism Superchain savings estimator and methodology
Optimism Superchain savings estimator and methodology
* zk rollup saving estimates
zk rollup saving estimates
* Rollup spending on posting data in February, prior to changing to blobs
Rollup spending on posting data in February, prior to changing to blobs
* OP Stack adds snap sync
OP Stack adds snap sync
* Fast finality optimistic rollup proposal, use check-in based model to reduce 7 day
window, honest minority assumption
Fast finality optimistic rollup proposal, use check-in based model to reduce 7 day
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP7645 : Alias ORIGIN to SENDER
EIPs:
* EIP7645 : Alias ORIGIN to SENDER
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7646 : Metadata management for NFTs ERC7647 : Fungible
NFTs (hybrid ERC20/721) ERC7648 : NFT recursive synthesis asset ERC7649 : Bonding
curve-embedded liquidity for NFTs
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7646 : Metadata management for NFTs
ERC7646 : Metadata management for NFTs
* ERC7647 : Fungible NFTs (hybrid ERC20/721)
ERC7647 : Fungible NFTs (hybrid ERC20/721)
* ERC7648 : NFT recursive synthesis asset
ERC7648 : NFT recursive synthesis asset
* ERC7649 : Bonding curve-embedded liquidity for NFTs
ERC7649 : Bonding curve-embedded liquidity for NFTs
Stuff for developers
* Hardhat: v2.21.0 : adds Ethereum Development Runtime (EDR) in Rust, replaces
TypeScript based Hardhat Network Multichain-deploy : Hardhat plugin using Sygma
Hardhat:
* v2.21.0 : adds Ethereum Development Runtime (EDR) in Rust, replaces TypeScript based
Hardhat Network
v2.21.0 : adds Ethereum Development Runtime (EDR) in Rust, replaces TypeScript based
* Multichain-deploy : Hardhat plugin using Sygma
Multichain-deploy : Hardhat plugin using Sygma
* Gaslite Bytecode20 : gas optimized ERC20 in EVM bytecode
Gaslite Bytecode20 : gas optimized ERC20 in EVM bytecode
* Return bombing : how to safely process revert data
Return bombing : how to safely process revert data
* Titanoboa (Vyper interpreter) Boa Solidity : adds Solidity support
Titanoboa (Vyper interpreter) Boa Solidity : adds Solidity support
* Snekmate v0.0.5 : for Vyper v0.3.10, adds multi-role-based timelock controller
Snekmate v0.0.5 : for Vyper v0.3.10, adds multi-role-based timelock controller
* Verifier alliance (VERA): shared database for verified contract source code
Verifier alliance (VERA): shared database for verified contract source code
* ERC4337 first year : 3M accounts, limited adoption depth, low retention,
fragmentation, only $200k in bundler revenue and multiple entry point upgrades
ERC4337 first year : 3M accounts, limited adoption depth, low retention, fragmentation,
only $200k in bundler revenue and multiple entry point upgrades
* Guide for dapps to adopt EIP6963 (multi injected provider discovery)
Guide for dapps to adopt EIP6963 (multi injected provider discovery)
* Wallet Test Framework test report 2
Wallet Test Framework test report 2
* CTFs: Secureum RACE #27 : 8 question Solidity quiz & answers
CTFs:
* Secureum RACE #27 : 8 question Solidity quiz & answers
* Goerli testnet no longer finalizing, Prysm users please update to latest release
candidate
Goerli testnet no longer finalizing, Prysm users please update to latest release
Security
* WOOFi $8.75M exploit on Arbitrum via price manipulation
Ecosystem
* ETHDenver videos and hackathon top 15 projects
Job Listings
* Waku hiring! Protocol Engineer , Waku SDK Software Engineer & Researcher
Waku hiring! Protocol Engineer , Waku SDK Software Engineer & Researcher
* IFT / Logos : ZK Researcher (Nomos); ZK Researcher (Vac) & ZK Engineer x2
IFT / Logos : ZK Researcher (Nomos); ZK Researcher (Vac) & ZK Engineer x2
* ChainSafe seek a Head of Protocol Engineering
ChainSafe seek a Head of Protocol Engineering
* Sr. Developer Relations Manager & Technical Writer at Powerloom
Sr. Developer Relations Manager & Technical Writer at Powerloom
* Devcon: Community Supporter , Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
Devcon: Community Supporter , Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
* TechOps are looking for DevOps . Work on projects such as MakerDAO.
TechOps are looking for DevOps . Work on projects such as MakerDAO.
* Nethermind: Distributed Systems Dev Lead & Cryptography Researcher
Nethermind: Distributed Systems Dev Lead & Cryptography Researcher
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 30.3 to 394.1 gwei, with 66.3 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 23.0 gwei 33.6k ETH net burn this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 30.3 to 394.1 gwei, with 66.3 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 23.0 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.0 gwei
* 33.6k ETH net burn this week
33.6k ETH net burn this week
* ETHUSD : $3,360 - $3,998, currently $3,897
ETHUSD : $3,360 - $3,998, currently $3,897
* ETHBTC : currently 0.057 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.057 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Maker voted to change DSR to 15%, Stability Fees to 15-17.25% & GSM to 16 hours
Maker voted to change DSR to 15%, Stability Fees to 15-17.25% & GSM to 16 hours
* Kwenta Perps v3 live on Base, beta
Kwenta Perps v3 live on Base, beta
* Power perpetuals include stablecoins, margined perpetual futures and AMMs
Power perpetuals include stablecoins, margined perpetual futures and AMMs
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC cease & desist against ShapeShift; SEC Republican members dissent
SEC cease & desist against ShapeShift; SEC Republican members dissent
* Wyoming Decentralized Unincorporated Nonprofit Association (DUNA) signed into law,
allows DAOs to setup a legal entity
Wyoming Decentralized Unincorporated Nonprofit Association (DUNA) signed into law,
* Optimismâ€™s RetroPGF: moving to narrow scope rounds & badgeholders paid for voting
Optimismâ€™s RetroPGF: moving to narrow scope rounds & badgeholders paid for voting
General
* Twitter calling enabled by default , leaks IP address, change your settings on mobile
Twitter calling enabled by default , leaks IP address, change your settings on mobile
* STIR (Shift To Improve Rate) : IOPP for RS codes, compared with FRI has shorter
arguments & faster verifier with fewer hashes
STIR (Shift To Improve Rate) : IOPP for RS codes, compared with FRI has shorter
* OpenZeppelin: incorrect computation of last challenge in KZG-based PLONK verifier
implementation
OpenZeppelin: incorrect computation of last challenge in KZG-based PLONK verifier
End of service: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-march-9-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Mar 13 â€“ mainnet Dencun upgrade epoch 269568 , ( watch party )
Mar 13 â€“ mainnet Dencun upgrade epoch 269568 , ( watch party )
* Mar 13-14 â€“ ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
Mar 13-14 â€“ ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
* Mar 15-17 â€“ ETHGlobal London hackathon
Mar 15-17 â€“ ETHGlobal London hackathon
* Mar 18 â€“ ZK grants round application deadline
Mar 18 â€“ ZK grants round application deadline
* Mar 19-21 â€“ ETH Canal (Panama City, PanamÃ¡) conference & hackathon
